meanings.definition: A person who is learning a trade from a skilled employer, having agreed to work for a fixed period at low wages.
meanings.sent1: The young apprentice eagerly watched the carpenter to learn how to build a table.
meanings.sent2: The apprentice worked hard to improve his skills under the guidance of the experienced blacksmith.
meanings.sent3: The apprentice accidentally glued his fingers together while trying to fix a broken chair.
meanings.sent4: As an apprentice in the kitchen, she quickly realized that timing in cooking was everything.
meanings.sent5: The apprentice's dedication to learning the art of pottery was truly inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The master craftsman decided to apprentice his son to the renowned glassblower in town.
meanings.sent2: She apprenticed herself to the famous painter to learn the techniques of portrait painting.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would apprentice his friend to the local baker if he burnt another batch of cookies.
meanings.sent4: The young musician felt apprenticed to the guitar, spending hours practicing chords and melodies.
meanings.sent5: The chef decided to apprentice the new cook to the head chef to learn the secrets of gourmet cuisine.
